H0.text: A beach is where a screech owl would most likely live, because screech owls nest in holes in trees and eat mice and crickets.

H1.text: A forest is where a screech owl most likely lives, since screech owls nest in holes in trees and eat mice and crickets.

H2.text: A desert is where a screech owl would most likely live, given that screech owls nest in holes in trees and eat mice and crickets.

H3.text: A rainforest is where a screech owl would most likely live, because screech owls nest in holes in trees and feed on mice and crickets.

A4.text: They prefer areas that contain old trees with hollows; these are home to their prey, which includes insects, reptiles, small mammals such as bats and mice, and small birds.

A5.text: Northern screech owls are found in eastern states, such as New Jersey and New York.
